pageTitle: Colby-Sawyer College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {69077=Mountain Day! Every year they pick a day in September and the president rings the bells to cancel classes. Buses come and load up all the students and bring us to Mt. Kearsarge to hike the mountain. There is a big cook-out and t-shirts to tye dye. Fun day!, 23544=If you're looking for a place to have a great connection with teachers, a friendly and safe environment while having fun at the same time, Colby-Sawyer is the place for you. One never thinks twice about their safety here as campus safety does a grab job of ensuring the well-being of everyone. With a small school consisting of less than 2000 students, you'll always see friendly faces you know., 118330=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 55174=We have this tradition where one day the bells will ring at 10:05 and that means it is mountain day. On mountain day we go to Mount Kearsarge, Tie-dye tee shirt, have lunch, and climb the mountain as a school. Its a great way to get to know each other and spend a day enjoying the schools unique tradition.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Will enjoy being here I slept over, attended a class, had a great time and I'm already considering myself as part of the community... It really is amazing!!!! Will learn a lot The advantage of being a rural school, is that the students will be more concentrated or focus on school than anything else that could keep them back from achieving their goals...
